contentrichtext.text: The '''Uniform Turkic Alphabet''' was a [[Latin alphabets|Latin alphabet]] used by non-[[Slavic peoples]] of the [[USSR]] in the 1930s. The alphabet used ligatures from [[Jaŋalif]] as it was also a part of the uniform alphabet. The uniform alphabet utilized Latin letters, excluding "w." Some additional letters were also introduced into the alphabet. [[Image:New Turkic alphabets.jpg|thumb|right|375px|Examples of Latin Turkic alphabets 1922-1940]] {|class=wikitable |- !colspan="32" | Uniform Turkic Alphabet |- | A || B || C || Ç || D | E || [[Ə]] || F || G || [[Gha|Ƣ]] | H || X || İ || J || K | Q || L || M || N ||[[Ꞑ]] || O | [[Ɵ]] || P || R || S || Ş | T || U || Y || V || Z | [[Z with stroke|Ƶ]] || Ь |- | a || b || c || ç || d | e || ə || f || g || ƣ | h || x || i || j || k | q || l || m || n || ꞑ || o | ɵ || p || r || s || ş | t || u || y || v || z | ƶ || ь |} ==See also== [[Latinisation (USSR)]] ==References== * Yakovlev N.F. ''"Development and succeeding problems in Latinizing alphabets"'', "Revolution and script" No 2, 1936, pp. 25–38 (In Russian) [http://www2.unil.ch/slav/ling/textes/Jakovlev36.html Н.Ф. ЯКОВЛЕВ: «О развитии и очередных проблемах латинизации алфавитов», Революция и письменность, № 2, 1936, стр. 25–38] [[Category:Latin alphabets]] [[Category:Turkic alphabets]] [[Category:1930s in the Soviet Union]] {{writingsystem-stub}} [[ru:Латинизация]]
